lead_paragraph: PHILLIOU--Philip J.,age 82, of Closter, NJ peacefully passed away on February 29, 2016 surrounded by loved ones. Philip is survived by his wife Marina; son Philip Jr. and his wife Annitsa, son Christopher and his wife Rachel, son Nicholas and his wife Arava, and son Demetrios; grandchildren Alexander and Paul Andreas, Willow May, and Jack. Philip is also survived by his brother, George Philliou. Philip's brother, Peter and sister, Norma predeceased him. For a man who traveled the world, Philip's two favorite places away from home were Astoria, Queens, New York and Siatista-Kozani, Greece. Siatista-Kozani was the birthplace of his parents and Astoria, his. Philip's youth revolved around school, his father's wholesale fur business and St. Demetrios Greek Orthodox church. Philip excelled at math and science throughout his academic career earning numerous academic achievement awards. Philip earned an academic scholarship to Brooklyn Technical High School. Philip received his Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1955 and his Master's degree from New York University in 1959. Philip was a senior executive for two international engineering firms over his career. He led major ethanol and petrochemical projects in Brazil, the US and Southeast Asia. Philip served as member of the parish council of the Cathedral of St. John the Theologian in Tenafly, NJ and assisted with Troop 25 Boy Scouts. Donations can be made in Philip's memory to the St. Philothea Philoptochos Society at Greek Orthodox Cathedral of St. John the Theologian in Tenafly, NJ. Wake to be held at the Barrett Funeral Home in Tenafly, NJ on Thursday, March 3rd from 2-4pm and 7-9pm, Funeral at the Greek Orthodox Cathedral of St. John the Theologian in Tenafly, NJ on Friday, March 4th at 11am. Interment Brookside Cemetery, Englewood. 1/3
